result.execSummary:
The defendant Theresa L. Hindsley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE makes statement on her own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Defendant Theresa L. Hindsley in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Theresa L. Hindsley in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen and intern Cody M. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.
Return date on May 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Theresa L. Hindsley in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Theresa L. Hindsley in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai gives status.  Likely to resolve.  Another pending matter to track with this case.  Request 2 week reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on May 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Theresa L. Hindsley appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Puck Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court explains warrant history in this case.  Atty. Tsai explains non appearance - transportation issues and kids.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $200 Cash bond.  Atty. Tsai makes bail argument for PA bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $200.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/Lake Delton Walmart  Return date scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Middleton not sure why client not here.  Not sure why on the calendar, warrant already issued.
Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant issue.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes warrant stayed until today.  Atty Middleton says he talked to DE a couple of times but she has a two month old child and couldn't be here today.  Requests reset and stay of warrant.  Court grants stay of one more week.  Return date scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Requests reset as the case is new to him so he can get an authorization.  Requests PTC and RD be set.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant but stays it one week.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
